key_points: Shannon Lee advocates for mandatory gun safety training on film sets using firearms.
Her brother, Brandon Lee, died in a similar accident on the set of 'The Crow' in 1993.
She believes actors should be able to check guns themselves and ensure everyone's safety.
Shannon expressed sympathy for Alec Baldwin, who accidentally killed cinematographer Halyna Hutchins on the 'Rust' set.
Brandon Lee's fiancée, Eliza Hutton, describes the 'Rust' incident as another 'avoidable tragedy.'
Hutton urges the film industry to consider alternatives to real guns on sets.
Alec Baldwin has been in contact with Hutchins' family and expresses concern for them.
The accidental shooting occurred when a gun, believed to be safe and loaded with blanks, contained real bullets.
The incident happened on Oct. 21, during a rehearsal on the 'Rust' set.
The investigation is ongoing, with no charges filed yet, but authorities are keeping 'all options on the table.'
